intro: Stephanocoma berkheyoides, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils and along dry streambeds. Its fibrous roots help it survive in harsh, drought-prone conditions.
